Designer Page

BIBLIOGRAPHY

My name is Adibah Hazwani binti Khairol Anuar and currently I am

studying in Bachelor of Graphic Design Majoring Illustration at

UiTM Perak Kampus Seri Iskandar. This is a storybook that I illustrat-

ed for my GDI625 Contemporary Illustration project.

This storybook is based on the history of the first Sultan of Perak,

Sultan Muzaffar Shah I. As a Perak citizen myself, I am so proud that

the theme for this project is stories from my state hometown. As I

illustrated this storybook, there are a lot of new discovery of Perak

origins that I encountered during this project and as its citizen, I will

absolutely never forget about its history as the history is what makes

Perak as it is right now.

I hope that readers can enjoy this storybook whilst knowing about the

beginning of Perak Sultanate and its first Sultan, Sultan Muzaffar

Shah I as well as what the Sultan had to go through before he was

enthroned as Perak Sultan.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

Cover

Editorial Page

Copyright Page

Bibliography

Table of Contents

Story Introduction

Story

Behind the Scene

Conclusion

STORY INTRODUCTION

“Why does the Sultan in the water?”

The story begins with a question by a little girl which she just

asked out of her curiosity. However, never did she know that her

curiosity will open the tale of a great legend from her hometown,

Perak Darul Ridzuan.

It is the legendary tale of the first Sultan of Perak, Sultan Muzaffar

Shah and what he had to do for him to be the ruler of Perak and the

pioneer of the Perak Sultanate that will continue to thrive until

these days.

Behind the Scene

CHARACTER DESIGN

COMPILATION

Tengku Muzaffar Shah / Sultan Muzaffar Shah I

The second prince of the last Sultan of Malacca Sultanate, Sultan

Mahmud Shah. He is later send to Perak to become its new ruler

and the pioneer of the Perak Sultanate.

Hawa

A little girl who lives in Perak. One day, she followed her grandfather

to Beting Beras Basah. There, she heard a legendary tale that will

make her could not forget what she saw that day.

Tok Khalid

Hawa’s grandfather. He has lived in Perak for decades and really loves to tell stories

of Perak to his granddaughter. One day, he went to Beting Beras Basah with her and

there he told Hawa of the story about the first Sultan of Perak.

Tun Saban

One of the two envoys from Perak who was entrusted by the previous ruler,

Tok Masuka, to plead to Sultan Mahmud Shah for sending his prince to rule

Perak after the death of its previous ruler, who died without a successor.

Nakhoda Kassim

One of the two envoys from Perak. As his title “Nakhoda’ depicted, he was the captain

of the ship that they used to travel from Perak to Kampar and then back to Perak. He

was looked after by the previous ruler, Tok Masuka when she was still alive.

Djinn

The djinn that resided Kuala Sungai Perak. Legend said that the djinn’s name is Dato

Mahkota Maharaja Si Raja Jin, which means that the djinn is the King of Djinn.

CONCLUSION

As a proud citizen of one’s hometown, it is a must to know about the history

of that place whether legends or folk tales as this is the very origin of the

place that we born and live. Without all the history and old tales as well as the

sacrifices that our ancestors have made, we will never able to live peacefully

like today. For example, if Sultan Muzaffar Shah I did not threw away his

crown, he might not be able to reach Perak and there will be no Perak Darul

Ridzuan that we know nowadays.

Therefore, it is important to appreciate history of places and important figures

of states and country so that all of the past deeds, sacrifices and incidents that

occured long time ago will still be remembered and remain in this world. The

future generations can follow the good and avoid the bad from past stories

and thus, will be able to have a life well-lived.

GDI625 Contemporary Illustration

Adibah Hazwani binti Khairol Anuar

Ts. Ahmad Sofiyuddin bin Mohd Shuib
